content.title: Angioplasty for FMD
content.description: Percutaneous transluminal angioplasty as treatment for symptomatic fibromuscular dysplasia

key_concepts.details: Renovascular hypertension with renal FMD, symptomatic carotid FMD
Balloon angioplasty usually sufficient; stenting generally not required
Technical success >95%; blood pressure cure/improvement in 60-80%
Reserved for symptomatic lesions; lower threshold for intervention if dissection

content.clinical_significance: Angioplasty is first-line treatment for symptomatic FMD stenosis
content.statement: Angioplasty for FMD is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Genetic-Disorders that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Angioplasty for FMD helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Angioplasty for FMD include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Angioplasty for FMD.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Angioplasty for FMD. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
